content.html:
I have a set of blurbs I use for “about me” sections of websites, including this one, depending on how many characters I’m allowed.

Avatars

2019–Present

Standard

2017–Present

Protest/Alternate

2015–2018

Standard

2015 (early)

Standard

2013–2015

Standard

2012 (late)

Standard

2012

Protest/Alternate

2012 (early)

Standard

2011

Standard

2010–2011

Standard

2008–2010

Standard

2006–2008

Standard

Full-length

Includes Microformats2 and Schema.org microdata.

Where: Flailing Wildly, Goodreads

Ryan Parman is an engineering manager with over 20 years of experience across software development, site reliability engineering, and security. He is the creator of SimplePie and AWS SDK for PHP, patented multifactor-authentication-as-a-service at WePay, defined much of the CI/CD and SRE disciplines at McGraw-Hill Education, and came up with the idea of “serverless, event-driven, responsive functions in the cloud” while at Amazon Web Services in 2010. Ryan's aptly-named blog, Flailing Wildly, is where he writes about ideas longer than 280 characters. Ambivert. Curious. Not a coffee drinker.

Full-length, no microdata

Where: Flickr, Quora

Ryan Parman is an engineering manager with over 20 years of experience across software development, site reliability engineering, and security. He is the creator of SimplePie and AWS SDK for PHP, patented multifactor-authentication-as-a-service at WePay, defined much of the CI/CD and SRE disciplines at McGraw-Hill Education, and came up with the idea of “serverless, event-driven, responsive functions in the cloud” while at Amazon Web Services in 2010. Ryan's aptly-named blog, Flailing Wildly, is where he writes about ideas longer than 280 characters. Ambivert. Curious. Not a coffee drinker.

Full-length, no HTML

Where: LinkedIn, Vimeo, OneName

Ryan Parman is an engineering manager with over 20 years of experience across software development, site reliability engineering, and security. He is the creator of SimplePie and AWS SDK for PHP, patented multifactor-authentication-as-a-service at WePay, defined much of the CI/CD and SRE disciplines at McGraw-Hill Education, and came up with the idea of “serverless, event-driven, responsive functions in the cloud” while at Amazon Web Services in 2010. Ryan's aptly-named blog, Flailing Wildly, is where he writes about ideas longer than 280 characters. Ambivert. Curious. Not a coffee drinker.

300 characters

Where: Bandcamp, Kickstarter, Letterboxd

Ryan Parman is an engineering manager with over 20 years experience across software development, site reliability, and security engineering. He created SimplePie and AWS SDK for PHP, patented MFA-as-a-service, and is the godfather of Serverless. Ambivert. Curious. Not a coffee drinker.

250 characters

Where: Unsplash

Engineering manager with 20+ years experience in software development, site reliability, and security. He created SimplePie and AWS SDK for PHP, patented MFA-as-a-service, and is the godfather of Serverless. Ambivert. Curious. Not a coffee drinker.

200 characters

Where: Keybase, Hacker News, Last.fm

Engineering manager with 20+ years in Software/DevOps/Security. Created SimplePie and AWS SDK for PHP. Patented MFA-as-a-service. The godfather of Serverless. Ambivert. Curious. Not a coffee drinker.

160 characters

Where: Angel.co, Foursquare, GitHub, Medium, Periscope, Pinterest, Twitter, Vimeo

Experienced Software/DevOps/Security engineer. Created SimplePie, AWS SDK for PHP, MFA-aaS. Godfather of Serverless. Ambivert. Curious. Not a coffee drinker.

140 characters

Where: HackerOne

Experienced DevSecOps engineer. Created SimplePie and AWS SDK for PHP. Godfather of Serverless. Ambivert. Curious. Not a coffee drinker.

Headlines/45 characters

Where: Feedly

Ambivert. Curious. Not a coffee drinker.

Markdown

Where: Coderwall, Micro.blog, StackOverflow

**Ryan Parman** is an engineering manager with over 20 years of experience across software development, site reliability engineering, and security. He is the creator of [SimplePie](http://simplepie.org) and [AWS SDK for PHP](https://aws.amazon.com/sdk-for-php/), patented [multifactor-authentication-as-a-service](https://patents.google.com/patent/US20160241536A1/en?inventor=Ryan+Parman) at [WePay](https://wepay.com), defined much of the CI/CD and SRE disciplines at [McGraw-Hill Education](https://www.mheducation.com), and came up with the idea of “[serverless, event-driven, responsive functions in the cloud](https://aws.amazon.com/lambda/)” while at [Amazon Web Services](https://aws.amazon.com) in 2010. Ryan's aptly-named blog, [Flailing Wildly](https://ryanparman.com), is where he writes about ideas longer than [280 characters](https://twitter.com/skyzyx). Ambivert. Curious. Not a coffee drinker.

summary.content: Design work where I have been the primary creative driver. FTO GTF [2015] Absolutely everything, soup-to-nuts. AWS Redesign [2012] Visual design, high-fidelity prototypes. Playback [2011] Visual design, front-end, PHP backend, AWS. Personal [2010] Interaction, visual design, front-end, PHP backend. CloudFusion [2010] Interaction, visual design, front-end, PHP backend. Personal [2009] Interaction, visual design, front-end, WordPress. Tarzan [2008] Interaction, visual design, front-end, PHP backend.

items.title: Follow Ryan
items.description: Follow me on social media, play video games with me, or send me cryptocurrency.

summary.content: 📬 Email I don't generally post my email address online. I generally receive over 10,000 inbound emails per month to my personal account, so if I don't know you, I'll probably delete or ignore it. But if you feel like rolling the dice, you can reach me at {firstname}@{firstname}{lastname}.com. If you are a technical recruiter, please don't be clueless. At the moment, I am not available for hire for freelance projects (sometimes this status changes). 🌀 Social Twitterhttps://twitter.com/skyzyx @media screen and (min-width: 30em) { .

content.html:
📬 Email

I don't generally post my email address online. I generally receive over 10,000 inbound emails per month to my personal account, so if I don't know you, I'll probably delete or ignore it. But if you feel like rolling the dice, you can reach me at {firstname}@{firstname}{lastname}.com.

If you are a technical recruiter, please don't be clueless. At the moment, I am not available for hire for freelance projects (sometimes this status changes).

I don't generally post my email address online. I generally receive over 10,000 inbound emails per month to my personal account, so if I don't know you, I'll probably delete or ignore it. But if you feel like rolling the dice, you can reach me at {firstname}@{firstname}{lastname}.com.

If you are a technical recruiter, please don't be clueless. At the moment, I am not available for hire for freelance projects (sometimes this status changes).

summary.content: .__h_social { -webkit-column-count: 2; -moz-column-count: 2; column-count: 2; } Projects that lived Tarzan https://aws.amazon.com/sdk-for-php/ An SDK for Amazon Web Services. Became the official AWS SDK for PHP in 2010. SimplePie https://github.com/simplepie A library for parsing RSS and Atom feeds in PHP. Became wildly popular and is now integrated into WordPress. Projects that died Blocker Blocked robots from visiting your website. Helped websites avoid referrer spam. FeedParser A pre-cursor to SimplePie, FeedParser parsed RSS 2.

content.html:
Projects that lived

Tarzan

https://aws.amazon.com/sdk-for-php/

An SDK for Amazon Web Services. Became the official AWS SDK for PHP in 2010.

SimplePie

https://github.com/simplepie

A library for parsing RSS and Atom feeds in PHP. Became wildly popular and is now integrated into WordPress.

Projects that died

Blocker

Blocked robots from visiting your website. Helped websites avoid referrer spam.

FeedParser

A pre-cursor to SimplePie, FeedParser parsed RSS 2.0 feeds in the browser with JavaScript.

Blogroller

This was the project I was building SimplePie for in the first place. No code ever got written because SimplePie became so popular.

RequestCore

This was discontinued after discovering Guzzle.
content.plain:
.__h_social { -webkit-column-count: 2; -moz-column-count: 2; column-count: 2; }  Projects that lived Tarzan https://aws.amazon.com/sdk-for-php/ An SDK for Amazon Web Services. Became the official AWS SDK for PHP in 2010.
  SimplePie https://github.com/simplepie A library for parsing RSS and Atom feeds in PHP. Became wildly popular and is now integrated into WordPress.
   Projects that died Blocker Blocked robots from visiting your website. Helped websites avoid referrer spam.
  FeedParser A pre-cursor to SimplePie, FeedParser parsed RSS 2.0 feeds in the browser with JavaScript.
  Blogroller This was the project I was building SimplePie for in the first place. No code ever got written because SimplePie became so popular.
  RequestCore This was discontinued after discovering Guzzle.
content.source:
Projects that lived

Tarzan

https://aws.amazon.com/sdk-for-php/

An SDK for Amazon Web Services. Became the official AWS SDK for PHP in 2010.

SimplePie

https://github.com/simplepie

A library for parsing RSS and Atom feeds in PHP. Became wildly popular and is now integrated into WordPress.

Projects that died

Blocker

Blocked robots from visiting your website. Helped websites avoid referrer spam.

FeedParser

A pre-cursor to SimplePie, FeedParser parsed RSS 2.0 feeds in the browser with JavaScript.

Blogroller

This was the project I was building SimplePie for in the first place. No code ever got written because SimplePie became so popular.

RequestCore

This was discontinued after discovering Guzzle.

Typically long-form writing. Link blog — Links I think are interesting. Tweet-worthy posts. Instagram photos. Combined: Main blog + Link blog — All of the above. content.tableOfContents:
• Content I Write
  • Media I Consume
  • Everything
content.html:
Do you have a feed reader? Do you use things like RSS or Atom feeds to subscribe to websites? Then this section is for you…

Content I Write

  • Main blog — The blog posts I write. Typically long-form writing.
  • Link blog — Links I think are interesting. Tweet-worthy posts. Instagram photos.
  • Combined: Main blog + Link blog — All of the above.

Media I Consume

  • Movies — Films I rate/review on Letterboxd.
  • TV Shows — TV shows that I watch, by episode. From Trakt.tv.
  • YouTube — YouTube videos that I mark as favorites.
  • Combined: Movies + TV Shows + YouTube — All of the above.

Everything

  • Everything — All of the above feeds rolled into one. Subscribing to this feed is full-on stalker status.
content.plain: Do you have a feed reader? Do you use things like RSS or Atom feeds to subscribe to websites? Then this section is for you… Content I Write  Main blog — The blog posts I write. Typically long-form writing. Link blog — Links I think are interesting. Tweet-worthy posts. Instagram photos. Combined: Main blog + Link blog — All of the above.  Media I Consume  Movies — Films I rate/review on Letterboxd. TV Shows — TV shows that I watch, by episode. From Trakt.tv. YouTube — YouTube videos that I mark as favorites. Combined: Movies + TV Shows + YouTube — All of the above.  Everything  Everything — All of the above feeds rolled into one. Subscribing to this feed is full-on stalker status.
content.source:
{{<description>}}
Do you have a feed reader? Do you use things like RSS or Atom feeds to subscribe to websites? Then this section is for you…
{{</description>}}

## Content I Write

* [Main blog](https://feed.ryanparman.com) — The blog posts I write. Typically long-form writing.
* [Link blog](https://feed.ryanparman.com/linkblog) — Links I think are interesting. Tweet-worthy posts. Instagram photos.
* [Combined: Main blog + Link blog](https://feed.ryanparman.com/content) — All of the above.

## Media I Consume

* [Movies](https://feed.ryanparman.com/movies) — Films I rate/review on [Letterboxd](https://letterboxd.com/skyzyx/).
* [TV Shows](https://feed.ryanparman.com/tv) — TV shows that I watch, by episode. From [Trakt.tv](https://trakt.tv/users/skyzyx).
* [YouTube](https://feed.ryanparman.com/youtube) — [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/Skyzyx) videos that I mark as _favorites_.
* [Combined: Movies + TV Shows + YouTube](https://feed.ryanparman.com/media) — All of the above.

## Everything

* [Everything](https://feed.ryanparman.com/conglomo) — All of the above feeds rolled into one. Subscribing to this feed is full-on stalker status.
